title: CanvasSize always empty on SKGLView
body:
### Description

I'm using `SKGLView` on `macOS` to draw some shapes on the canvas, if I query for the `CanvasSize` of the `SKGLView `it's always empty (`Width = 0, Height = 0`). If I use a regular `SKCanvasView` instead of the `SKGLView `everything works as expected.

### Code
```
[Outlet]
SkiaSharp.Views.Mac.SKGLView CanvasView { get; set; }
CanvasView.PaintSurface += CanvasView_PaintSurface;

void CanvasView_PaintSurface(object sender, SKPaintGLSurfaceEventArgs e)
{
    Debug.WriteLine(CanvasView.CanvasSize);
    //output: {Width=0, Height=0}
}

```

### Expected Behavior
The `CanvasSize `property should not be empty, instead it should hold the values of the current size of the canvas. It works if a `SKCanvasView `is used instead of `SKGLView`.

### Actual Behavior

`CanvasSize `is empty (`Width=0, Height=0`)

### Basic Information

- Version with issue:  1.60.3
- IDE:  Visual Studio for Mac 7.6.10 (build 27)
- Platform Target Frameworks: macOS
  - macOS: 10.14
- Target Devices:
  -   MacBook Pro 13'' (2018)
  -   MacBook Pro 15'' (2016)
